Lazy Caesar Salad Recipe | Bon Appétit

Our weeknight hack? Using store-bought mayo as the base for the sauce. This streamlined version has everything you want—creamy, pungent dressing, crunchy romaine, umami-rich Parm, and freshly toasted croutons—all in perfect balance, with no special equipment or raw egg yolk required.All products featured on Bon Appétit are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through the retail links below, we earn an affiliate commission.What you’ll needChevronChevronMeasuring Spoons$10 At Bon Appétit MarketMeasuring Cups$18 At Bon Appétit MarketLarge Bowl$18 At AmazonSmall Rimmed Baking Sheet$28 At AmazonMicroplane$16 At AmazonCutting Board$10 At IKEAChef's Knife$34.53 At AmazonWhisk$10 At AmazonVegetable Peeler$10 At AmazonPlatter$29 At AmazonIngredients4 servings½medium boule or loaf sourdough bread (about 10 oz.)3Tbsp. plus ⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oilKosher saltFreshly ground black pepper1garlic clove1(or more) oil-packed anchovy fillet, drained2Tbsp. Dijon mustard2Tbsp. fresh lemon juice2Tbsp. mayonnaise13-oz. piece Parmesan2–3romaine heartsPreparationStep 1Preheat oven to 425°. Tear ½ boule sourdough bread into 1" bite-sized pieces, using only the fluffy white interior and discarding the crusts (you should have about 3 cups).Step 2Place bread in a large bowl and drizzle with 3 Tbsp. oil. Season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.Step 3Transfer bread to a small rimmed baking sheet and arrange in a single layer (reserve bowl for making the salad). Bake, shaking sheet to toss once halfway through, until croutons are golden and crispy all over but still squishable in the center, 10–12 minutes. Let cool. (You’re done with the oven, so shut it off.)Step 4While croutons bake and cool, assemble your dressing. Finely grate 1 garlic clove into reserved bowl with a microplane.Step 5Place 1 anchovy (if you’re a fan of anchovies and want to taste them in the dressing, use 2) on a cutting board and mash into a paste with the flat side of a chef's knife. Add to bowl with garlic.Step 6Whisk 2 Tbsp. mustard, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, and 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise into bottom of bowl until mixture is incorporated.Play/Pause ButtonPausePlay/Pause ButtonPauseChevronChevronStep 7Whisking constantly, slowly stream in remaining ⅓ cup oil. Continue whisking vigorously until you have a thick, creamy, smooth dressing.Step 8Using a vegetable peeler, shave 3 oz. Parmesan into shards, then break up any larger pieces with your fingertips.Step 9Tear 2 romaine hearts into bite-sized pieces directly into bowl with dressing. Season lightly with salt, then generously with pepper.Step 10Add about three-quarters of cheese and about three-quarters of croutons to salad and toss gently with clean hands until lettuce is coated. If romaine hearts were small and salad looks a little overdressed, add some of the remaining romaine heart.Step 11Transfer salad to a platter. Top with remaining cheese and croutons.How would you rate Lazy Caesar Salad?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (10)Back to TopTriangleNever buying bottled Caesar dressing again… so easy. I tossed all the ingredients in a wide mouth mason jar and hit it with an immersion blender.

Also making your own croutons makes a world of difference. Honestly use whatever bread you have on hand - I’ve tried this with several different kinds of bread and even sandwich bread works in a pinch!

Perfectly quick and so delicious!!!SKLos Angeles 10/29/2021This is a great recipe. I used half the mustard. (Not a fan of mustardy) And to think that I made this on the spur of the moment, then to my huge dismay I had NO fresh garlic. Nada. What?!!! That Has NEVER happened in my kitchen since 1982! Omg! I always always have garlic! I subbed a lot of dried garlic granules and it STILL turned out great! Stored 3/4 of the beautiful  emulsified dressing for another time. Ate 1/4 of the salad in a state of bliss. 
Divine! O-Sushi-QAnacortes, Washington10/26/2021Great dressing recipe! I doubled it and made the entire dressing in a mason jar using an emersion blender. Only 3 tweaks: 3 anchovies, HALF a cup of oil (as opposed to 2/3) and 2 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce for the DOUBLE dressing recipe.
